compounddef.title: wxUSE preprocessor symbols defined by wxWidgets

detaileddescription.para: This section documents the wxUSE preprocessor symbols used in the wxWidgets source, grouped by category (and sorted by alphabetical order inside each category).

These symbols are always defined and whether the given feature is active or not depends on their value: if defined as 1, feature is active, otherwise it is disabled. Because of this these symbols should be always tested using #if and not #ifdef.

para.ref: wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only under Unix platforms
wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in wxX11 Platform
wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in wxGTK port
wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in wxMac port
wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in wxMotif port
wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in Cocoa port
wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in OS2 port
wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in wxMSW port
wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in wxUniversal

sect1.title: Most important wxUSE symbols
sect1.para: This table summarizes some of the global build features affecting the entire library:

entry.para: Container classes and wxString are implemented using standard classes and provide the same standard API.
wxString is implemented using std::[w]string and can be constructed from it (but provides wxWidgets-compatible API, in particular is implicitly convertible to char* and not std::[w]string).
Standard C++ classes are used instead of or in addition to wx stream classes.
Compiled with Unicode support (default in wxWidgets 3.0, non-Unicode build will be deprecated in the future).
wxString uses wchar_t buffer for internal storage (default under MSW).
wxString uses UTF-8 for internal storage (default under Unix and Mac systems).
Library supports running only under UTF-8 (and C) locale. This eliminates the code necessary for conversions from the other locales and reduces the library size; useful for embedded systems.
Use the GUI classes; if set to 0 only non-GUI classes are available.
Use wxAcceleratorTable/Entry classes and support for them in wxMenu, wxMenuBar.
In wxPostScriptDC class use AFM (adobe font metrics) file for character widths.
Use standard low quality icons in wxArtProvider.
IEEE Extended to/from double routines; see src/common/extended.c file.
When enabled use native OS configuration instead of the wxFileConfig class.
Enable event loop in console programs.
If set to 0, no classes deriving from wxControl can be used.
Use wxPluginManager and related classes. Requires wxDynamicLibrary
enable XML support using expat parser.
Use extended RTTI, see also Runtime class information (RTTI)
Use virtual archive filesystems like wxArchiveFSHandler in wxFileSystem class.
Use virtual HTTP/FTP filesystems like wxInternetFSHandler in wxFileSystem class.
This is not a user-settable symbol, it is only used internally in wx/generic/mdig.h.
Override global operators new and delete to use wxWidgets memory leak detection
Support Windows ICO and CUR formats.
Enables the wxImage handler for Amiga IFF images.
Use experimental wxIPV6address and related classes.
Enables PNG format support (requires libpng). Also requires wxUSE_ZLIB.
Enabled when wxLog used with __WXDEBUG__ defined.
Use native long long type in wxLongLong implementation.
Use wxWidgets memory leak detection, not recommended if using another memory debugging tool.
Use wxMessageDialog class and wxMessageBox function.
Please use wxUSE_GLCANVAS to test for enabled OpenGL support instead.
Use interface for owner-drawn GUI elements.
Use wxVsnprintf which supports positional parameters.
Provide methods for spline drawing in wxDC.
Use native support for some operations with wxURL.
Enable XPM reader for wxImage and wxBitmap classes.
Use wxZlibInput and wxZlibOutputStream classes, required by wxUSE_LIBPNG.

sect1.title: wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only under Unix platforms

entry.para: Use wxEpollDispatcher class. See also wxUSE_SELECT_DISPATCHER.

sect1.title: wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in wxX11 Platform

entry.para: Use wxUniv's implementation of wxTextCtrl class.

sect1.title: wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in wxGTK port

entry.para: Use code to detect X11 session manager.
Use GNOME VFS support. Currently has no effect.
Use Hildon framework for Nokia 770. Currently has no effect.

sect1.title: wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in wxMac port
wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in wxMotif port

entry.para: Use xmCascadeButtonGadgetClass, xmLabelGadgetClass, xmPushButtonGadgetClass and xmToggleButtonGadgetClass classes.

sect1.title: wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in Cocoa port
wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in OS2 port
wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in wxMSW port

entry.para: Enable use of windows common dialogs from header commdlg.h; example PRINTDLG.
Use generic wxDatePickerCtrl implementation in addition to the native one.
Use InkEdit library. Related to Tablet PCs.
Use to prevent the auto generation, under MSVC, of manifest file needed by windows XP and above.
Using headers whose author is Anders Norlander.
Enable use of riched32.dll in wxTextCtrl
Enable use of riched20.dll in wxTextCtrl
Use MSLU for Unicode support under Windows 9x systems.

sect1.title: wxUSE preprocessor symbols used only in wxUniversal

entry.para: Use all themes in wxUniversal; See wx/univ/theme.h file.
Use simple monochrome theme in wxUniversal
